title: Mozart: Sinfonia Concertante etc. - Midori, Imai (2001)
description:
Billboard [7/7/2001]:
"With all the complaints about there being nothing new under the classical sun, it's strange that Sony wouldn't more actively herald the release of a beautifully produced disc featuring a full-scale completion of a long-missed Mozart fragment. Still, here it isâ€”Philip Wilby's version of Mozart's Concerto for Violin and Piano re-created from the composer's 120-bar sketch, plus material from the K. 306 Violin Sonata (supposedly a model for the planned double concerto that Mozart lovers know from references in his Mannheim/Paris letters). The result is a thoroughly lovely, if not overwhelmingly persuasive workâ€”relayed with tonal richness by violinist Midori and eminent Mozartian Christoph Eschenbach on piano and leading the fine NDR band. Esteemed violist Nobuko Imai joins Midori for a true Mozart masterpiece, the life-affirming Sinfonia Concertante in E flat major." --BB

WOLFGANG AMADEUS MOZART (1756-1791)
1-3 Sinfonia Concertante in E-flat Major
4-6 Concerto for Violin, Piano and Orchestra in D Major

Midori, violin
Nobuko Imai, viola
Christoph Eschenbach, piano & conductor
NDR-Sinfonieorchester

Recorded in NDR, Rolf Liebermann Studio, Hamburg, Germany, on September 28 and October 2, 2000
Producer: Steven Epstein
